intro: Pithecellobium diversifolium, commonly known as the variable-leaf pisonia, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of the Americas. It is characterized by its compound leaves, which vary in shape and size across different parts of the plant. The species produces small, white or pale yellow flowers that are clustered in inflorescences. Its fruit is a follicle that contains several seeds, and the plant is often found in humid, lowland forests. The botanical features of Pithecellobium diversifolium make it an important component of its native ecosystems.
